content: I completely agree! Providing dedicated bike lanes and separating bikes from cars and pedestrians can make bike transportation much safer and more efficient, encouraging more people to use bicycles instead of cars for short distance trips. Additionally, ensuring that bike parking facilities are available and easily accessible at public transportation locations, such as bus and train stations, can incentivize people to combine biking with public transit for longer distance trips. Overall, enhancing bike infrastructure is a crucial step in improving sustainability and reducing carbon emissions in cities.
